isa_json.title: A large-scale multicenter breast cancer DCE-MRI benchmark dataset with expert segmentations
isa_json.description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) research in breast cancer Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) faces challenges due to limited expert-labeled segmentations. We present a multicenter dataset of 1506 pre-treatment T1-weighted dynamic contrast-enhanced MRI cases, including expert annotations of primary tumors and non-mass-enhanced regions. The dataset integrates imaging data from four collections in The Cancer Imaging Archive (TCIA). A deep learning model was trained to produce preliminary segmentations for the remaining cases, which were subsequently corrected and verified by 16 breast cancer experts. The resource includes 49 harmonized clinical and demographic variables, as well as pre-trained weights for a baseline nnU-Net model.

steps.name: Data Collection from TCIA
steps.description: Collected pre-treatment T1-weighted DCE-MRI cases from four public collections in TCIA: I-SPY1 (171 cases), I-SPY2 (980 cases), NACT-Pilot (64 cases), and Duke-Breast-Cancer-MRI (291 cases), totaling 1506 cases after exclusion criteria (e.g., lack of clinical outcome data, poor contrast enhancement, artifacts).

steps.name: Harmonization of Clinical and Imaging Data
steps.description: Consolidated and harmonized clinical and imaging data into a single table, including 21 clinical variables, 6 demographic variables, and 22 imaging parameters. Standardized naming and folder structure for all sequences.

steps.name: Image Orientation Standardization
steps.description: Axial MRIs were reoriented to the LAS (left-anterior-superior) coordinate system, while sagittal MRIs were reoriented to the PSR (posterior-superior-right) coordinate system.

steps.name: Preliminary Automatic Segmentation
steps.description: Trained a baseline nnU-Net model on 331 existing expert segmentations (from DUKE and TCGA-BRCA) to produce preliminary segmentations for the 1506 MAMA-MIA cases. Preprocessing included cropping to VOI and resampling to 1x1x1 mm³ isotropic pixel spacing.

steps.name: Visual Quality Control of Automatic Segmentations
steps.description: Two expert breast radiologists visually inspected the preliminary automatic segmentations on 2D slices (axial, sagittal, coronal) from the first post-contrast image and categorized them as Good, Acceptable, Poor, or Missed. This step was blinded to the experts performing corrections.

steps.name: Expert Manual Correction
steps.description: 16 experts manually corrected, inspected, and verified the preliminary automatic segmentations for 1095 missing cases (plus 411 existing expert segmentations were also reviewed). Experts segmented the primary tumor in the first post-contrast phase using the Mango viewer tool, following specific guidelines (e.g., segmenting only the primary lesion, excluding lymph nodes).

identified_tools.name: nnU-Net
identified_tools.description: A standard state-of-the-art deep learning model used to produce preliminary segmentations and for which pre-trained weights were shared.

identified_tools.name: Mango viewer
identified_tools.description: The tool selected for experts to correct the automatic segmentations.

identified_tools.name: pycad
identified_tools.description: Python library used to transform original DICOM images from TCIA to NIfTI format.

identified_tools.name: seg-metrics 1.2.7
identified_tools.description: Python library used to compute metrics like Dice coefficient and 95% Hausdorff Distance.

identified_tools.name: matplotlib
identified_tools.description: Used for plotting MRI images in Jupyter notebooks.

identified_tools.name: pandas
identified_tools.description: Used for filtering and visualizing clinical and imaging data.

identified_models.name: Baseline nnU-Net Model (Pre-trained Weights)
identified_models.description: A vanilla nnU-Net model trained on the 1506 expert segmentations of primary tumors for transfer learning and benchmarking.

identified_models.name: Preliminary Segmentation Model
identified_models.description: Model trained on 331 segmentations (DUKE and TCGA-BRCA) used to generate initial segmentations for expert correction.

identified_measurements.name: Expert Primary Tumor Segmentations
identified_measurements.description: 1506 expert-corrected 3D segmentations of the primary lesion in pre-treatment DCE-MRI (first post-contrast phase).

identified_measurements.name: Preliminary Automatic Segmentations
identified_measurements.description: Initial segmentations generated by the nnU-Net model before expert correction.

identified_measurements.name: Expert Quality Scores
identified_measurements.description: Categorical quality assessment (Good, Acceptable, Poor, Missed) assigned by two expert radiologists to the preliminary automatic segmentations.

identified_measurements.name: Dice Similarity Coefficient (DSC)
identified_measurements.description: Calculated between automatic and expert segmentations.

identified_measurements.name: 95 percentile Hausdorff Distance (HD)
identified_measurements.description: Calculated between automatic and expert segmentations.

identified_measurements.name: Functional Tumor Volume (FTV)
identified_measurements.description: Volume derived from SER and PE images, used as an approximate VOI/segmentation for comparison against expert segmentation.

identified_measurements.name: Harmonized Clinical and Demographic Variables
identified_measurements.description: 21 clinical, 6 demographic, and 22 imaging parameters for all 1506 cases.

confidence_scores.Expert_Correction_Consistency: Moderate (Cohen's Kappa 0.39 for 4 categories, improved to 0.53 for binary)
